correspAction.name: the Société Impériale Zoologique d'Acclimatation, Paris

head.supplied: [The price of the different species of Eucalyptus seeds varies considerably depending on the greater or less ease with which they are collected.] Thus the price of some species can be estimated at 15 ...

div.p: To the Société Impériale Zoologique d'Acclimatation, Paris

Letter not found. The text given here (B71.12.02) is from Raveret-Wattel (1871). The quotations given are cited by Raveret-Wattel as from 'lettre du 22 March 1870'. The page numbers given in the notes below are to Bulletin de la Société Impériale Zoologique d'Acclimatation, series 2, vol. 8.
While the citation is to a letter, it is highly probable that the text is that of the 'mémoire de M. le docteur von Mueller' transmitted by the British Ambassador to Paris (see notes to M to J. McCulloch, 22 March 1873). Some parts of the presumed memorandum not directly quoted by Raveret-Wattel but attributed to M are assumed to come from the same source, but they are not extracted here, since as with letters or reports from a number of other authors, it is not always clear when the material based on information from the different contributors begins and ends. The sequence of the extracts here preserves their relative position in the article.
[Le prix des différentes espèces de graines de l' Eucalyptus varie considérablement selon le plus ou moins de facilité avec laquelle on les recueille.] Ainsi
'dit M. Müller,' is inserted at this point. le prix de quelques espèces peut être évalué à 15 schillings (environ 20 francs)
The parentheses in the quotation here and below may have been inserted by Raveret-Wattel. la livre, tandis que d'autres espèces coûtent environ 3 livres sterling (75 francs) la livre.
p. 625.

[M. Lissignol, secrétaire de la Société d'acclimatation de Victoria, conseille-t-il de ne transplanter les jeunes arbres qu'après les chaleurs de l'été.
Attributed to a letter from Lissignol, 6 March 1870, recipient not stated, p. 628. Tel est également l'avis de M. le docteur Müller:] Les graines de beaucoup d'espèces étant petites, il convient
'dit-il,' is inserted at this point. de les semer sur couches et de transplanter les jeunes sujets à l'entrée de la saison froide et des temps pluvieux.

p.seg: [The price of the different species of Eucalyptus seeds varies considerably depending on the greater or less ease with which they are collected.] Thus the price of some species can be estimated at 15 shillings (about 20 francs) per pound, while other species cost about £3 sterling (75 francs) per pound.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Compare these prices with that given for E. globulus in M to W. Odgers, 11 August 1869 (in this edition as 69-08-11a), and M to W. Odgers, 9 September 1869.

p.seg: [Mr. Lissignol, the secretary of the Victorian Acclimatisation Society, advises to transplant the young trees only after the heat of summer. This is also the opinion of Dr. Müller:] As the seeds of many species are small, it is advisable to sow them on beds and to transplant the young subjects at the start of the cold season and rainy weather.
